Dear Sheffield City Council,
How much funding have you provided for the following activities in each of the last four years (20/21, 21/22, 22/23, 23/24):
1. Welfare Rights/specialist benefits advice provision delivered in-house by the local authority
a. What is the total amount spent per year?
b. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from core council budgets such as: general fund, housing rent account, social care, childrens social services budgets services or other in-house budgets (i.e. excluding specific grants spent on benefit advice provision e.g HSF or covid recovery or other time-limited grants)
c. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from NHS/public health sources
d. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from grant funding (including time-limited grants such as HSF)/arrangements from other sources
e. Please specify the grants/other sources/arrangements referred to in 1c and d
2. Welfare Rights/specialist benefits advice provision delivered by voluntary/community/partner organisations
a. What is the total amount spent per year?
b. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from core council budgets such as: general fund, housing rent account, social care, childrens social services budgets services or other in-house budgets (i.e. excluding specific grants spent on benefit advice provision e.g HSF or covid recovery or other time-limited grants)
c. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from NHS/public health sources
d. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from grant funding (including time-limited grants such as HSF)/arrangements from other sources
e. Please specify the grants referred to in 2c and d
3. General advice provision which may include benefits advice by voluntary/community/partner organisations
a. What is the total amount spent per year?
b. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from core council budgets such as: general fund, housing rent account, social care, childrens' social services budgets services or other in-house budgets (i.e. excluding specific grants spent on benefit advice provision e.g HSF or Covid recovery or other time-limited grants)
c. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from NHS/public health sources
d. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from grant funding (including time-limited grants such as HSF)/arrangements from other sources
e. Please specify the grants referred to in 3c and d
Yours faithfully,
Dan Manville
North West Rep
National Association of Welfare Rights Advisers

Dear Dan Manville,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Advice Sector

Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. Welfare Rights/specialist benefits advice provision delivered in-house
by the local authority a. What is the total amount spent per year?
b. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from core council
budgets such as: general fund, housing rent account, social care,
childrens social services budgets services or other in-house budgets (i.e.
excluding specific grants spent on benefit advice provision e.g HSF or
covid recovery or other time-limited grants) c. What proportion (or

proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from grant funding (including
time-limited grants such as HSF)/arrangements from other sources e. Please
specify the grants/other sources/arrangements referred to in 1c and d
We do not have any specialist welfare benefits advice in house. The above
questions are nonapplicable.

voluntary/community/partner organisations

b. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from core council

childrens social services budgets services or other in-house budgets (i.e.

health sources
d. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from grant funding

sources
e. Please specify the grants referred to in 2c and d

3. General advice provision which may include benefits advice by
voluntary/community/partner organisations
a. What is the total amount spent per year?
b. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from core council
budgets such as: general fund, housing rent account, social care,
childrens' social services budgets services or other in-house budgets
(i.e. excluding specific grants spent on benefit advice provision e.g HSF
or Covid recovery or other time-limited grants)
c. What proportion (or amount) of this funding comes from NHS/public
health sources

We can say that remaining grant aid programme of approx £2.2m funds the

connections and may include some benefits advice.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
